intro: Dasyglossum confertum, commonly known as the dense-lipped daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in fine hairs, giving them a fuzzy appearance. Dasyglossum confertum is often found in grasslands and rocky areas, where it thrives in full sun and well-drained soils.
